discussion.content:
C is correct 
In a federated environment, user authentication is separated from user access.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/admin-security-fed-auth-overview#what-is-a-federated-environment

choices.B: To provide real-time monitoring of user activities
choices.C: To separate user authentication from user access
choices.D: To enable direct integration with external databases
choices.A: To enhance data security and privacy

questions.question_text: Why is a federated environment used for user authentication in Snowflake?

choices.C: The provisioning of additional compute resources will be in effect when the warehouse is next resumed.
choices.D: The warehouse will resume immediately and start to share the compute load with other running virtual warehouses.
choices.B: The warehouse will remain suspended but new resources will be added to the query acceleration service.
choices.A: The provisioning of new compute resources for the warehouse will begin immediately.

questions.question_text: What will happen if a Snowflake user increases the size of a suspended virtual warehouse?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C -> Resizing a suspended warehouse does not provision any new compute resources for the warehouse. It simply instructs Snowflake to provision the additional compute resources when the warehouse is next resumed, at which time all the usage and credit rules associated with starting a warehouse apply.

D correct.
